alert.note: Alert for Collier; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 3:17PM EDT until September 28 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Collier and Mainland Monroe. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains with a feeder band over the Gulf of Mexico that will be moving west northwest towards the coastal areas of Southern Collier County. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from earlier feeder bands yesterday into last night. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with this approaching feeder band. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Everglades City, Carnestown, Plantation Island, Copeland, Big Cypress National Preserve, Everglades National Park and Port Of The Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
